description: Retrieves a list of details for automation rules based on rule Amazon Resource Names (ARNs).

nested_items.name: Rules
nested_items.description: A list of rule details for the provided rule ARNs.

nested_items.name: RuleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a rule.

nested_items.name: RuleStatus
nested_items.description: Whether the rule is active after it is created. If this parameter is equal to ENABLED, Security Hub starts applying the rule to findings and finding updates after the rule is created.

nested_items.name: RuleOrder
nested_items.description: An integer ranging from 1 to 1000 that represents the order in which the rule action is applied to findings. Security Hub applies rules with lower values for this parameter first.

nested_items.name: RuleName
nested_items.description: The name of the rule.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the rule.

nested_items.name: IsTerminal
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a rule is the last to be applied with respect to a finding that matches the rule criteria. This is useful when a finding matches the criteria for multiple rules, and each rule has different actions. If a rule is terminal, Security Hub applies the rule action to a finding that matches the rule criteria and doesn't evaluate other rules for the finding. By default, a rule isn't terminal.

nested_items.name: ProductArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a third-party product that generated a finding in Security Hub.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to a string value when filtering Security Hub findings.
To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.
To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, the filter AwsAccountId EQUALS 123456789012 only matches findings that have an account ID of 123456789012.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.name: AwsAccountId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID in which a finding was generated.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to a string value when filtering Security Hub findings.
To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.
To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, the filter AwsAccountId EQUALS 123456789012 only matches findings that have an account ID of 123456789012.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The product-specific identifier for a finding.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to a string value when filtering Security Hub findings.
To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.
To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, the filter AwsAccountId EQUALS 123456789012 only matches findings that have an account ID of 123456789012.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.name: GeneratorId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the solution-specific component that generated a finding.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to a string value when filtering Security Hub findings.
To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.
To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, the filter AwsAccountId EQUALS 123456789012 only matches findings that have an account ID of 123456789012.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: One or more finding types in the format of namespace/category/classifier that classify a finding. For a list of namespaces, classifiers, and categories, see Types taxonomy for ASFF in the Security Hub User Guide.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to a string value when filtering Security Hub findings.
To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.
To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, the filter AwsAccountId EQUALS 123456789012 only matches findings that have an account ID of 123456789012.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.name: FirstObservedAt
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when the potential security issue captured by a finding was first observed by the security findings product.

nested_items.name: Start
nested_items.description: A timestamp that provides the start date for the date filter.

nested_items.name: End
nested_items.description: A timestamp that provides the end date for the date filter.

nested_items.name: DateRange
nested_items.description: A date range for the date filter.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: A date range value for the date filter.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: A date range unit for the date filter.

nested_items.name: LastObservedAt
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when the security findings provider most recently observed a change in the resource that is involved in the finding.

nested_items.name: Start
nested_items.description: A timestamp that provides the start date for the date filter.

nested_items.name: End
nested_items.description: A timestamp that provides the end date for the date filter.

nested_items.name: DateRange
nested_items.description: A date range for the date filter.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: A date range value for the date filter.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: A date range unit for the date filter.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when this finding record was created.

nested_items.name: Start
nested_items.description: A timestamp that provides the start date for the date filter.

nested_items.name: End
nested_items.description: A timestamp that provides the end date for the date filter.

nested_items.name: DateRange
nested_items.description: A date range for the date filter.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: A date range value for the date filter.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: A date range unit for the date filter.

nested_items.name: UpdatedAt
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when the finding record was most recently updated.

nested_items.name: Start
nested_items.description: A timestamp that provides the start date for the date filter.

nested_items.name: End
nested_items.description: A timestamp that provides the end date for the date filter.

nested_items.name: DateRange
nested_items.description: A date range for the date filter.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: A date range value for the date filter.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: A date range unit for the date filter.

nested_items.name: Confidence
nested_items.description: The likelihood that a finding accurately identifies the behavior or issue that it was intended to identify. Confidence is scored on a 0---100 basis using a ratio scale. A value of 0 means 0 percent confidence, and a value of 100 means 100 percent confidence. For example, a data exfiltration detection based on a statistical deviation of network traffic has low confidence because an actual exfiltration hasn't been verified. For more information, see Confidence in the Security Hub User Guide.

nested_items.name: Gte
nested_items.description: The greater-than-equal condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

nested_items.name: Lte
nested_items.description: The less-than-equal condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

nested_items.name: Eq
nested_items.description: The equal-to condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

nested_items.name: Gt
nested_items.description: The greater-than condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

nested_items.name: Lt
nested_items.description: The less-than condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

nested_items.name: Criticality
nested_items.description: The level of importance that is assigned to the resources that are associated with a finding. Criticality is scored on a 0---100 basis, using a ratio scale that supports only full integers. A score of 0 means that the underlying resources have no criticality, and a score of 100 is reserved for the most critical resources. For more information, see Criticality in the Security Hub User Guide.

nested_items.name: Gte
nested_items.description: The greater-than-equal condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

nested_items.name: Lte
nested_items.description: The less-than-equal condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

nested_items.name: Eq
nested_items.description: The equal-to condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

nested_items.name: Gt
nested_items.description: The greater-than condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

nested_items.name: Lt
nested_items.description: The less-than condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

nested_items.name: Title
nested_items.description: A finding's title.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to a string value when filtering Security Hub findings.
To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.
To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, the filter AwsAccountId EQUALS 123456789012 only matches findings that have an account ID of 123456789012.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: CompanyName

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.

nested_items.name: ResourceType
nested_items.description: The type of resource that the finding pertains to.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to a string value when filtering Security Hub findings.
To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.
To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, the filter AwsAccountId EQUALS 123456789012 only matches findings that have an account ID of 123456789012.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the given resource type. For Amazon Web Services resources that are identified by Amazon Resource Names (ARNs), this is the ARN. For Amazon Web Services resources that lack ARNs, this is the identifier as defined by the Amazon Web Services service that created the resource. For non-Amazon Web Services resources, this is a unique identifier that is associated with the resource.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to a string value when filtering Security Hub findings.
To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.
To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, the filter AwsAccountId EQUALS 123456789012 only matches findings that have an account ID of 123456789012.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.name: ResourcePartition
nested_items.description: The partition in which the resource that the finding pertains to is located. A partition is a group of Amazon Web Services Regions. Each Amazon Web Services account is scoped to one partition.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to a string value when filtering Security Hub findings.
To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.
To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, the filter AwsAccountId EQUALS 123456789012 only matches findings that have an account ID of 123456789012.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.name: ResourceRegion
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region where the resource that a finding pertains to is located.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to a string value when filtering Security Hub findings.
To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.
To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, the filter AwsAccountId EQUALS 123456789012 only matches findings that have an account ID of 123456789012.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.name: ResourceTags
nested_items.description: A list of Amazon Web Services tags associated with a resource at the time the finding was processed.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the map filter. For example, for ResourceTags, Key identifies the name of the tag. For UserDefinedFields, Key is the name of the field.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value for the key in the map filter. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, one of the values for a tag called Department might be Security. If you provide security as the filter value, then there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to the key value when filtering Security Hub findings with a map filter.

To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, for the ResourceTags field, the filter Department CONTAINS Security matches findings that include the value Security for the Department tag. In the same example, a finding with a value of Security team for the Department tag is a match.

To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, for the ResourceTags field, the filter Department EQUALS Security matches findings that have the value Security for the Department tag.

nested_items.name: ResourceDetailsOther
nested_items.description: Custom fields and values about the resource that a finding pertains to.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the map filter. For example, for ResourceTags, Key identifies the name of the tag. For UserDefinedFields, Key is the name of the field.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value for the key in the map filter. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, one of the values for a tag called Department might be Security. If you provide security as the filter value, then there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to the key value when filtering Security Hub findings with a map filter.

To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, for the ResourceTags field, the filter Department CONTAINS Security matches findings that include the value Security for the Department tag. In the same example, a finding with a value of Security team for the Department tag is a match.

To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, for the ResourceTags field, the filter Department EQUALS Security matches findings that have the value Security for the Department tag.

nested_items.name: ComplianceStatus
nested_items.description: The result of a security check. This field is only used for findings generated from controls.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.name: ComplianceSecurityControlId
nested_items.description: The security control ID for which a finding was generated. Security control IDs are the same across standards.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: ComplianceAssociatedStandardsId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of a standard in which a control is enabled. This field consists of the resource portion of the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) returned for a standard in the DescribeStandards API response.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: RelatedFindingsProductArn
nested_items.description: The ARN for the product that generated a related finding.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to a string value when filtering Security Hub findings.
To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.
To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, the filter AwsAccountId EQUALS 123456789012 only matches findings that have an account ID of 123456789012.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.name: RelatedFindingsId
nested_items.description: The product-generated identifier for a related finding.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to a string value when filtering Security Hub findings.
To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.
To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, the filter AwsAccountId EQUALS 123456789012 only matches findings that have an account ID of 123456789012.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.name: NoteText
nested_items.description: The text of a user-defined note that's added to a finding.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison

To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.

nested_items.name: NoteUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp of when the note was updated.

nested_items.name: Start
nested_items.description: A timestamp that provides the start date for the date filter.

nested_items.name: End
nested_items.description: A timestamp that provides the end date for the date filter.

nested_items.name: DateRange
nested_items.description: A date range for the date filter.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: A date range value for the date filter.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: A date range unit for the date filter.

nested_items.name: NoteUpdatedBy
nested_items.description: The principal that created a note.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to a string value when filtering Security Hub findings.
To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, the filter Title CONTAINS CloudFront matches findings that have a Title that includes the string CloudFront.
To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, the filter AwsAccountId EQUALS 123456789012 only matches findings that have an account ID of 123456789012.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.name: UserDefinedFields
nested_items.description: A list of user-defined name and value string pairs added to a finding.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the map filter. For example, for ResourceTags, Key identifies the name of the tag. For UserDefinedFields, Key is the name of the field.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value for the key in the map filter. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, one of the values for a tag called Department might be Security. If you provide security as the filter value, then there's no match.

nested_items.name: Comparison
nested_items.description: The condition to apply to the key value when filtering Security Hub findings with a map filter.

To search for values that include the filter value, use CONTAINS. For example, for the ResourceTags field, the filter Department CONTAINS Security matches findings that include the value Security for the Department tag. In the same example, a finding with a value of Security team for the Department tag is a match.

To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, for the ResourceTags field, the filter Department EQUALS Security matches findings that have the value Security for the Department tag.

nested_items.name: ResourceApplicationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application that is related to a finding.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

To search for values that start with the filter value, use PREFIX. For example, the filter ResourceRegion PREFIX us matches findings that have a ResourceRegion that starts with us. A ResourceRegion that starts with a different value, such as af, ap, or ca, doesn't match.

nested_items.description: The name of the application that is related to a finding.

nested_items.name: AwsAccountName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Web Services account in which a finding was generated.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string filter value. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, the product name for control-based findings is Security Hub. If you provide security hub as the filter value, there's no match.

nested_items.name: Actions
nested_items.description: One or more actions to update finding fields if a finding matches the defined criteria of the rule.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Specifies the type of action that Security Hub takes when a finding matches the defined criteria of a rule.

nested_items.name: FindingFieldsUpdate
nested_items.description: Specifies that the automation rule action is an update to a finding field.

nested_items.name: Text
nested_items.description: The updated note text.

nested_items.name: UpdatedBy
nested_items.description: The principal that updated the note.

nested_items.name: Normalized
nested_items.description: The normalized severity for the finding. This attribute is to be deprecated in favor of Label.
0 - INFORMATIONAL.
40---69 - MEDIUM.
90---100 - CRITICAL.

nested_items.name: Product
nested_items.description: The native severity as defined by the Amazon Web Services service or integrated partner product that generated the finding.

nested_items.name: Label
nested_items.description: The severity value of the finding. The allowed values are the following.
INFORMATIONAL - No issue was found.
LOW - The issue does not require action on its own.
MEDIUM - The issue must be addressed but not urgently.
HIGH - The issue must be addressed as a priority.
CRITICAL - The issue must be remediated immediately to avoid it escalating.

nested_items.name: VerificationState
nested_items.description: The rule action updates the VerificationState field of a finding.

nested_items.name: Confidence
nested_items.description: The rule action updates the Confidence field of a finding.

nested_items.name: Criticality
nested_items.description: The rule action updates the Criticality field of a finding.

nested_items.name: Types
nested_items.description: The rule action updates the Types field of a finding.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: UserDefinedFields
nested_items.description: The rule action updates the UserDefinedFields field of a finding.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the investigation into the finding. The workflow status is specific to an individual finding. It does not affect the generation of new findings. For example, setting the workflow status to SUPPRESSED or RESOLVED does not prevent a new finding for the same issue.
NEW - The initial state of a finding, before it is reviewed. Security Hub also resets WorkFlowStatus from NOTIFIED or RESOLVED to NEW in the following cases:
The record state changes from ARCHIVED to ACTIVE.
The compliance status changes from PASSED to either WARNING, FAILED, or NOT_AVAILABLE.
NOTIFIED - Indicates that you notified the resource owner about the security issue. Used when the initial reviewer is not the resource owner, and needs intervention from the resource owner.
RESOLVED - The finding was reviewed and remediated and is now considered resolved.
SUPPRESSED - Indicates that you reviewed the finding and don't believe that any action is needed. The finding is no longer updated.

nested_items.name: RelatedFindings
nested_items.description: The rule action updates the RelatedFindings field of a finding.

nested_items.name: ProductArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the product that generated a related finding.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The product-generated identifier for a related finding.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when the rule was created.

nested_items.name: UpdatedAt
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when the rule was most recently updated.

nested_items.name: CreatedBy
nested_items.description: The principal that created a rule.

nested_items.name: UnprocessedAutomationRules
nested_items.description: A list of objects containing RuleArn, ErrorCode, and ErrorMessage. This parameter tells you which automation rules the request didn't retrieve and why.

nested_items.name: RuleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the unprocessed automation rule.

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: The error code associated with the unprocessed automation rule.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: An error message describing why a request didn't process a specific rule.
